Exploring different methods for telling time

Oct 20, 2016

A day is (about) the amount of time it takes for the Earth to perform one rotation. There are 86,400 seconds in a day. This is because weâ€™ve decided that a day is split into 24 hours, each split into 60 minutes, each split into 60 seconds. Humans chose that, just like they chose a base-10 number system. Explore different options here and see how things would change.

24 : 60 : 60
